intro: Christella hilsenbergii, commonly known as the Hilsenbeck's Christella, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its foliage consists of broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
